title: For Sale/Trade:  Russian Tula SKS 1952 ALL ORIGINAL, non-refurb
postcontent:
Russian SKS Tula 1952 ALL ORIGINAL, NOT a factory refurb. This is a collectors grade rifle. No re-arsenal markings or signs of refurbishment anywhere on this rifle. It has all matching numbers on the bolt, carrier, stock, receiver, receiver cover, magazine, trigger guard, rear sight, and gas tube. It has the original blade bayonet, original cleaning rod, original cleaning kit, 10 stripper clips, 200 rounds of Russian match grade 7.62x39 ammo, and case. The bore is bright and shiny with strong rifling. The bluing is original and none of the pats have been painted over later. The stock is its original dark hardwood finish and has the original serial number without being forced matched and having a bunch of XXXXX's over the old serial number. The stock has no cracks or deep gouges, just minor handling wear. The receiver cover is marked with the Tula star inside the star logo and has the date stamp of 1952r under the logo. I bought this gun over a year and a half ago and it has sat in the safe ever since. I have never fired it, and never planned to in order to keep it in the collectors condition it is currently in. I know what this gun is worth as would any serious SKS collector so please don't try to low ball me and compare this with the Yugo's and Norinco's out there. Take a look at gunbroker for similar condition rifles and you will see that there are few out there and are worth every bit of my asking price. 

Asking $650 obo.  I am located in Dublin and if you want to buy this, you must be willing to meet me in this area. My job doesn't typically allow me time to travel beyond the Dublin area. If interested, email me. Thanks for looking.

title: For Sale:  ANTIQUE   GUN   RESTORATION
postcontent:
Almost every family has great grandpa's old shotgun. It may have been in the family for generations! It is a keepsake but needs to be put into better shape. Parts may be missing or it won’t work. It may be rusty and the wooden parts deteriorated. You may simply want the old thing professionally cleaned -OR- Refurbished to a presentable state – OR - you may want it put into LIKE NEW shape! Perhaps you wish to present this family treasure, fully restored, for Christmas? Don't wait. It may take us DAYS to complete your project - once we get yours in line. 
We have a huge inventory or antique and hard-to-find parts along with hundreds of stocks and forearms. If we don’t have the antique part we may have to order it or – even MAKE it. As an example, most of the guns we restore are over 100 years old! For the time being at least, pre-1899 guns are completely EXEMPT from all federal laws. 
We can offer Professional Results. Your family heirloom will look, "Good as great Grandpa bought it!"
We are not a dealer and do not sell guns. However, we can restore your family treasure to its original out-of-the box appearance. Each project is priced based upon the level of complexity at the customer's request and the current condition of the piece. Most of our projects are old shotguns and rifles.
Reply to this website or call Jim @ 901-497-7045 
Email: jmoffatt@thebesttimes.com

I've had this for a few years, mounted on a rifle that saw perhaps 100 rounds of range use.  I've gone another direction, and am ready to sell this excellent scope at a loss.  I am willing to ship.

Here is what the ad text from the manufacturer states:

Product Highlights The Leupold Mark 4® CQ/T™ 1-3x14mm is a revolutionary optical sight for tactical firearms such as the AR15 and M16, combining the strengths of a red dot sight and a variable-power riflescope. Only the Mark 4® CQ/T™ is ready and able to handle the variety of situations most common to both law enforcement and the military.

The Mark 4 CQ/T also has range-estimating capabilities. Aside from the standard dot, this has an outer circle. This is the key for range estimation. A 6' target will fit snug inside the circle at 100 yards. At 200 yards the 6 ft. target will fit in-between the center dot and the circle. Even I couldn't mess that up!

The Circle Dot reticle of the Mark 4 CQ/T is designed to offer fast target acquisition in any environment. Dot Size: 3 MOA at 3x, 9 MOA at 1x. Circle Size: Edge to edge, the subtension of the circle is 18 inches at 25 yards, or 6 feet at 100 yards when set on 3x. From the center of the dot to the edge of the circle, the subtension is 6 feet at 200 yards when set on 3x. Circle Line: The width of the line creating the circle is large enough to be easily visible, but thin enough so as not to obliterate an 18-inch object at 500 yards when set on 3x. Range Estimating -Place the target inside the circle of the CQ/T reticle. At 3x the diameter equates to 6 feet in height at 100 yards. At 200 yards, 6 feet is measured from the dot to the edge of the circle.

title: For Sale:  PK-A Red Dot Sight Weaver mount
postcontent: This is a nice rugged red dot sight that I picked up for $230 plus shipping. It's great for a flat top AR. I don't have an AR so my complaint is that it mounts too high on any mount you could possibly use to put it on an AK. I have used it off and on hunting and at the range with the same battery stored in it for 3 years now. Battery life isn't great it's only supposed to be 50 hours but it certainly doesn't drain the battery life in storage. The sight also has a nice bright 1MOA dot that's visible on the brightest of days yet turns down nice and low for low light or night shooting. I hate to get rid of it but it just isn't low enough for me. It's in like new condition no nicks dings or scratches. The instructions on the knobs are in Russian and I have to case and manual for it.

title: For Sale:  United States Arms Abilene .357 Single Action Revolver
location: Las Vegas & S Academy, Colorado Springs, Colorado
postcontent:
SA Collectors, 1970's era US Arms Abilene .357 Revolver, 4 5/8" adjustable sight, crisp light trigger thats silky smooth and calling the lock up "rock solid" is an understatement, all steel frame and ejector rod housing instead of the alloy of the Ruger, deep blue fit and polish of a Colt Python in 98+% with just a hint of storage and a slight bit of wear on the cylynder, bore and chambers are excellent, old style cylinder pin held in place with a screw.  

This revolver is in excellent original condition with the original fitted cardboard box with the same serial number as the handgun.  The US Arms medallion grips are in excellent shape with only a few minor marks.  The US Arms Abilene company of Riverhead, NY, shares the same roots as the Sporting Arms, Inc, Seville.  The Abilene was intended to compete head to head with the Ruger Blackhawk.  

If you are looking for a great .357 Single Action, don't let this get away, it is far nicer than any modern equivalent.  Shot very little.  Has the traditional 1/2 cock position of the Colt SA.  I can provide the history of the handgun as I'm only the 3rd owner.  It has the transfer bar safety and was the subject of a lawsuit against them by Ruger.  After face to face discussion, Bill Ruger agreed to allow the patent to be used by US Arms.  

The gun is a reloaders dream as the .357 cylinder is a .44 Mag cylinder blank drilled for the .357 caliber.  Very tight tolerances.  See www.singleactions.com for additional information.

Sold ftf with valid CO drivers liscense or CCW.  Shipping direct to FFL is $35, if FFL to FFL, additional $20 (exactly my costs).  This firearm can be transferred within the State of California per the California DOJ Firearms Website.

title: For Sale:  ANTIQUE   GUNS   RESTORED
postcontent:
Almost every family has great grandpa's old shotgun. It may have been in the family for generations! It is a keepsake but needs to be put into better shape. Parts may be missing or it won’t work. It may be rusty and the wooden parts deteriorated. You may simply want the old thing professionally cleaned -OR- Refurbished to a presentable state – OR - you may want it put into LIKE NEW shape! Perhaps you wish to present this family treasure, fully restored, for Christmas? Don't wait. It may take us DAYS to complete your project - once we get yours in line. 
We have a huge inventory or antique and hard-to-find parts along with hundreds of stocks and forearms. If we don’t have the antique part we may have to order it or – even MAKE it. As an example, most of the guns we restore are over 100 years old! For the time being at least, pre-1899 guns are completely EXEMPT from all federal laws. 
We can offer Professional Results. Your family heirloom will look, "Good as great Grandpa bought it!"
We are not a dealer and do not sell guns. However, we can restore your family treasure to its original out-of-the box appearance. Each project is priced based upon the level of complexity at the customer's request and the current condition of the piece. Most of our projects are old shotguns and rifles.
Reply to this website or call Jim @ 901-497-7045 
Email: jmoffatt@thebesttimes.com

The SR9c compact pistol has the same slim 1.27" grip width (across safety levers) as the full-sized SR9. It comes with two magazines, holding 10 rounds and 17rounds with adapter. The 3.50" barreled pistol features an integral accessory rail that accommodates most lights and lasers. The SR9c compact pistol also features high-visibility 3-Dot sight, serrations are located on the front portion of the slide, making it easier to both manipulate the slide and to press check the chamber. The SR9c is available with a glass-filled nylon frame and through-hardened slide in either a brushed stainless or blackened finish. Just like the original, full-sized SR9, the SR9c is loaded with modern safety features like a 1911-style ambidextrous manual safety, internal trigger bar interlock and striker blocker, trigger safety, magazine disconnect, plus a visual and tactile loaded chamber indicator.

Specifications

Type : Pistol
Action : Double Action Only
Caliber : 9mm
Barrel Length : 3 1/2"
Capacity : 17 + 1w/adapter, 10+1 w/extension
Safety : Ambidextrous
Grips : Glass Filled Nylon
Sights : 3-Dot
Weight : 23.4 oz
Finish : Stainless Steel
View it on our Online Store

title: For Sale:  Springfield Armory M1922 Mk II .22
postcontent:
This is a very nice Springfield Armory M1922 Mk II. Serial # 13616B. According to the info I have found, and had sent to me, it started life in 1928 as a 1922M1. The second 1 looks hand stamped after modifications. Later the type M2 bolt, stock and magazine were added. Serial number etched on the bolt matches the receiver number. The sling looks to be a WWII era model 1907. The sights are NOT the correct Lyman 48C but aftermarket Lyman 57SME, front and rear. Bore is in near perfect condition.

Asking $950.00  If shipped buyer will pay actual shipping cost. Will ship to FFL holders only. Will e-mail additional pics if asked. . Money Orders or Certified checks only. Actual shipping charges may be paid in a separate personal check when exact charges are known.

title: For Sale:  Non Ethanol Premium in Lake Oswego , Oregon ...
postcontent:
In Lake Oswego Oregon

For contact Info and address
Visit
http://www.davespalisadesautocare.com/

Thank YOU


My personal tests in a 92 Chevy PU, 91 Toyota Corolla and Yamaha TT500, Honda XR 500 and a Yamaha 660 grizzly... - Faster starts , Crispier throttle response the 92 Chevy received 6 miles to the gallon better ... the Toyota already was getting 30 MPG but jumped to 34 in addition my wife admitted she drove it faster because it felt better ... ...


This was a interesting find ...

Fuel type also affects mileage. Most gasoline in the U.S. today is 8-10 percent ethanol, but the EPA does its tests with 100 percent gasoline in the tank. The use of ethanol to increase the amount of oxygen in gasoline for better combustion can reduce fuel efficiency by around 6 percent all by itself.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


ethanol is about 29.8 kJ/gram combusted

octane is about 44.2 kJ/gram combusted

but ethanol is denser and because fuel efficiency for liquids is based on volumetric rates not mass rates it comes out to

ethanol is 23.5 kJ/mL

octane is about 31.2 kJ/mL
that is 75% the fuel density

so that 15% ethanol is 25% less fuel rich then pure gasoline.

so bottom line is that 15% ethanol fuel is 96% as energy rich as 100% gasoline by volume

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


More Info - http://www.fuel-testers.com/ethanol_...ms_damage.html

http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,266785,00.html

http://www.goldeagle.com/UserFiles/f...the%20Ugly.pdf

Offered for sale is the pictured investment grade original Cactus Forge Malachite Bowie made by Gilbert " Gib " Guignard (12/02/35 - 7/15/05). This is a one of a kind handmade Bowie Knife with a beautiful Handmade Leather Sheath. I am the original owner of this knife and it has never left my home. The knife has been valued by Blade Gallery at 400.00. This Knife is in as new condition. The description is as follows:
Maker: Gib Guignard, Weight: 26.72 oz,Blade Length: 9"Total Length: 14", Blade Thickness: 0.24", Blade Width: 1.87", Blade: 5160 Carbon Steel with a rustic finish, Bolster: Nickel Silver Guard and Butt, Handle: Polished Elk Antler with a marbleized Malachite spacer, Sheath: Brown Leather with lace up, Comments: Gib Guignard subscribed to the Neo Tribal way of thinking. His knives are finished with a rustic look which is just like it came from the forge. The bevels are ground giving the knife blade a two tone look. This crates an antique appearance which is very unique.
The balance falls slightly forward of the guard on this wonderful Bowie making it very quick in the hand. The 9" long blade is forged 5160 Carbon Steel with a rustic finish that is offset by the bright polished Elk Antler handle. The handle is separated from the Nickel Silver Guard by a marbleized Malachite spacer.
Comes with all of the original paperwork from The Blade Gallery ensuring authenticity.
There will be no more knives from this unique craftsman. This is a rare opportunity to own one of his uncompromising masterpieces.

postcontent:
True survival slings. 

-Typical rifle sling

-Two/single point tactical slings 

----- Quick detach swivels
----- Hk style hooks
----- Snap enclosure ends


I designed these slings to incorporate:

-70+' of real 550 paracord
-over 25' 8lb. mono fishing line (inside off weave #2)
-3 fishing hooks 
-1 sewing needle sewn inside patch on webbing
-5' sewing thread
-7" stainless survival knife 
-flint/ magnesium bar
-compass (that works)

These slings include what I consider to be essentials in a wilderness survival application. A fire building method, shelter building tools, a means to catch and/or hunt food, a sturdy knife, navigation tool, sewing kit, and even if the slings paracord is dismantled entirely, a sling can be made using the 1" webbing and sewing kit included.

Slings are typically adjustable from 33"-43" (can be custom made to your desire)

Three colors to choose from (for now) Woodland camo & black; black & black; pink & black.

Prices range from $30 for just plain paracord sling. $55 for survival sling w/ knife. More pics upon request.  Shipping is $5.00.

title: For Sale:  Winchester Model 94 30-30
location: North Raleigh, Raleigh / Durham / CH, North Carolina
postcontent:
My dad purchased his rifle new in the mid 1960's for hunting deer in upstate New York, that was nearly fifty years ago.  As a kid I remember him bringing home at least six buck over the 10 years he hunted.  A while back he mentioned to me that he'd only ever bought two boxes of cartridges and nearly fifty years later I still have almost a full box left.  When asked what happened to the other cartridges he said he took out an Oak tree every now and then for practice.  Dad passed earlier this year, and we no longer have a need for his rifle, but mom would like it to go to someone who'll actually use it.  She also wants a fair price.  A local gun shop I visited earlier today said it was worth about $500, but their offer to buy it was well under half that. title: For Sale:  New Kel Tec KSG
postcontent:
Brand new nver fired in the box in black! OBO local please!

This simple and reliable pump action feeds from either the left or right tube. The feed side is manually selected by a lever located behind the trigger guard. The pump includes an under picatinny rail for the mounting of a forward grip, a light, or a laser. The included top picatinny sight rail will accept many types of optics or iron sights. Forward and rear sling loops are built in, and a basic sling is included. The soft rubber butt pad helps to tame recoil. The KSG receiver is made from hardened steel and includes the magazine tubes which have been welded in place. The grip and stock assembly is made of glass reinforced nylon (Zytel) and is easily disassembled by pushing out 2 pins, which store in 2 holes in the grip when removed. The barrel and pump assembly is removed by loosening the 2 front magazine tube nuts with a coin and sliding the assembly forward.
